questions.question: What does the slope (b) in a linear regression model represent?

answers.c: The change in exam score per unit increase in study hours

explanations.a: The predicted exam score is the output Y, not the slope.
explanations.b: The average score is a statistic from the dataset, not part of the regression equation.
explanations.c: Correct!The slope (b) tells us how much the final score is expected to increase (or decrease) for each additional hour studied.
explanations.d: The error is represented by ε, not the slope b.

questions.question: Which metric is used to measure the average squared difference between actual and predicted values?

explanations.a: R-squared measures the proportion of variance explained, not error directly.
explanations.b: MAE measures average absolute differences, not squared differences.
explanations.c: RMSE is the square root of MSE, not the MSE itself.
explanations.d: Correct!MSE measures the average of the squares of the errors between actual and predicted values.

questions.question: What is the role of the intercept (a) in the regression equation?

answers.a: It indicates the strength of correlation
answers.c: It shows the exam score when study hours are zero
answers.d: It is the standard deviation of the model

explanations.a: Correlation is a separate statistical concept, not directly represented by the intercept.
explanations.b: The error term is represented by ε, not the intercept a.
explanations.c: Correct!The intercept is the expected value of Y (score) when X = 0 (no study hours).
explanations.d: Standard deviation measures spread, unrelated to the intercept value.

questions.question: What is the purpose of using a testing dataset in model evaluation?

answers.c: To assess model performance on unseen data

explanations.a: The training dataset is used to train the model, not testing.
explanations.b: While data visualization can use any data, this is not the main purpose of testing data.
explanations.c: Correct!The testing set is used after training to see how well the model performs on new, unseen data.
explanations.d: Outlier detection is part of data preprocessing, not testing.

questions.question: Why is it important to preprocess data before applying linear regression?

answers.b: To ensure the model learns from clean and accurate input
answers.d: To remove the linear relationship from the data

explanations.a: The goal is to improve model accuracy, not reduce R².
explanations.b: Correct!Preprocessing (handling missing values, removing outliers, etc.) ensures data quality and improves model performance.
explanations.c: Preprocessing does not necessarily create new independent variables unless feature engineering is involved.
explanations.d: Linear regression requires a linear relationship; removing it would harm model accuracy.
